column2: ?       Bachelors degree in business administration, engineering, or a related field; MBA preferred. column2: This role is critical to the successful execution of the Project. In this specific case, the position is for Brown Field project (offshore- Oil & Gas)                          The role of Project Manager is in charge of the execution of the scope within budget, schedule and quality .                          The PM s main tasks are as follows:                         Schedule management                         Coordination of E, P and C activities                          Fabrication yard subcontract management                          Change management                             The PM will travel to Angola or other centers ( in this case Monaco, Schiedam ) as necessary.                         Previous significant experience in brownfield projects and/or shutdown/turnaround planning and/or maintenance planning is a plus                          Previous experience of contract administration with ExxonMobil or similar client                         Solid knowledge / experience of FPSO projects environment                         Excellent skills of communication and stakeholder management                         The PM will also be responsible to make sure the interface with operations ( for Brown field projects) is working well and for the handover of the data once the offshore works will have been executed offshore (as-builts, vendor document, AMOS data base, etc. ).                           ROLE PURPOSE                     The Project Manager has the overall responsibility to deliver the Project in accordance with both the contractual requirements and SBM s internal requirements.                    You may be assigned to lead Projects or to such tasks as Interface Management, Delivery Management, Area Management, or Change Management, depending upon the size and complexity of the Project.                   ROLE CONTRIBUTION                     1. In order to build an    effective project management team    you are to:                            Lead the team inspiring others to achieve the project as per plan                          Define and maintain the project organization, responsibilities and accountabilities                          Ensure the team has the balance of skills and expertise required to deliver the Project.                          Manage communication and reporting across all internal Project members.                          Foster team work and cooperation within the Project and with stakeholders                                2. In order to    deliver project as per plan   , you are to:                            Provide the leadership direction required to successfully deliver (initiate, plan, execute, control, and close-out) a Project                          Lead the HSSE and Quality culture throughout the project.                          Own the Execution Strategy, Project Execution Plan, and Project Business Plan                          Communicate the Project objectives/ targets to the Project team and stake holders.                          Be the primary focal point with the Client and manage the communications, reporting and relationship with the client                          Challenge performance in all aspects of the Project                          Optimize costs and manage project cash flow                          Optimize revenues & ensure the Management of Change and Risk processes are followed                          Ensure the contract baseline (costs, schedule, scope, regulatory, rely upon data, client obligations, acceptance criteria, notification requirements, insurance cover, obligations, liabilities etc.) is summarized and communicated to the Project team                          Ensure that the Client is notified as soon as a change in scope is detected in accordance with the terms of the contract

column2: We are in search of a dynamic and driven individual to join our team as a Manager for the Employee Volunteering Program. In this leadership role, you will be responsible for overseeing the development, implementation, and management of our EVP, ensuring alignment with our companys values and corporate social responsibility objectives. The Manager will collaborate closely with internal and external stakeholders to create impactful volunteering opportunities that contribute to positive social change.           Responsibilities                 1.      Program Leadership:             Develop and execute the strategic vision for the Employee Volunteering Program, in line with the organizations values and social responsibility goals.         Stay abreast of industry best practices and emerging trends to continually enhance the programs effectiveness and relevance.         Identify and evaluate potential nonprofit partners and community organizations for strategic collaboration.               2.      Volunteer Engagement:             Plan, coordinate, and oversee a diverse range of volunteer activities, from one-time events to long-term partnerships, ensuring meaningful and impactful experiences for participants.         Foster a culture of volunteerism within the organization, promoting active participation and engagement among employees.               3.      Stakeholder Management:             Cultivate and maintain strong relationships with nonprofit organizations, community groups, and other external partners to facilitate successful collaborations.         Collaborate closely with corporate partners to promote volunteering opportunities and encourage employee participation in the program.               4.      Metrics and Reporting:             Establish key performance indicators (KPIs) to assess the success and impact of the Employee Volunteering Program.         Regularly monitor, analyze, and report on program metrics, leveraging data insights to drive continuous improvement and innovation.               5.      Content Development:             Develop educational materials and resources to raise awareness about the value of volunteering and provide guidance to employees on how to get involved.         Support employees in identifying volunteering opportunities that align with their skills, interests, and schedules.               6.      Team Management:             Lead and mentor a team of associates or coordinators responsible for program implementation and execution.         Provide guidance, support, and professional development opportunities to team members to foster growth and success.           Mandatory Qualification and Experience:               Masters degree in a relevant field (e.g., Social Sciences, Nonprofit Management, Business Administration) or equivalent practical experience.         3+ years of experience in program management, corporate social responsibility, nonprofit engagement, or related roles, with demonstrated leadership abilities.         Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to build and maintain relationships with diverse stakeholders.         Strong project management capabilities, including planning, execution, and evaluation.         Proficiency in data analysis and reporting, with the ability to translate insights into actionable strategies.           Passion for social responsibility and community engagement.             Desirable               Experience working with multi-disciplinary teams in a fast-paced environment.         Excellent counseling, listening, decision-making, and communication skills.         Previous experience working in rural or remote areas.         Willingness to travel for project-related work.         Compassionate nature with the ability to connect with and support individuals in need.

column2: Responsibility: Charter: - Understand program objectives and prepare the program charter. - identify benefits and success criteria of the program. - Track and report contribution of the program to the defined benefits of the program. - Define the program structure aligned with the program charter. - identify the relevance of various projects subprograms and their contribution to the program. - identify multiple MSI Program Managers Project Manager and let them build the individual subprogram project charter in line with the overall program charter. - Identify relevance of the various projects and their contribution to the Program. - identify multiple Project Managers and guide them to build individual project charter in line with the overall program charter. - Identify program dependencies and critical decision discussion points. - consolidate all the individual projectsubprogram plans and integrate the same into a program plan. Set Up: - Program Initiation and Planning: Create integrated program plan covering multiple work streams projects including aspects such as cost, schedule, program scope, requirements, risk, quality, communication & stakeholder management, effort estimation, resource planning, measurement criteria or metrics for every work stream and consolidate the same to arrive at the final estimate for the project. - share the same with Stakeholders. - define OCM strategy and process. - Program Governance: Identify the stakeholders, Review the subprogram governance with the concerned MSI Program Managers. - Set up the communication plan and escalation process. - validate lifecycle methodology of various projects as developed by the PMs. - Dependency Management: Identify dependencies across work streams. - Program Risk Management: Anticipate risks at the onset and during the course of the program. - Benefits Management: Understand and communicate the benefits from the program. - track them through the course of the program. Contracting: - Leverage the MSA structure to review the SOWs work orders to understand the commitment expectations. - Prepare the SOW work orders. - negotiate on resources, time, milestones etc during scoping of the program. - Review the program scope as created by multiple ProjectAccount Managers against the client acceptance criteria at the program level. Delivery: - Reviews: Conduct program reviews with relevant stakeholders to identify manage issues & risks and ensure smooth delivery provide delivery governance and resolve escalated project issues affecting the program. - review and monitor all phases of the project (requirements gathering, design, architecture, development, testing, implementation, warranty) on a regular basis and suggest corrective actions. - initiate corrective actions in project(s) where variance is found. - Tracking: Track actual vs planned program progress. - collaborate with the Project Managers of individual projects to create review and track the project management plan as well as subsidiary plans including the cost, schedule, staffingpyramid management?, scope, requirements, risk, quality, communication & stakeholder management. - provide support and guidance on the individual projects to Project Managers and facilitate seamless integration of various pieces in the overall Program. - Conflict Management: Anticipate conflict situations and oversee timely resolution of escalated issues. - Risk Management: Identify risks at the beginning in partnership with Project Manager. - review issues and risks for each of the project(s) with the Project Manager, as per the risk management plan. - engage with the delivery team to critically review and detect early warning signals that pose threats to the overall program objectives. - communicate risks to the Engagement Manager. - implement HMP in the program. - prioritize risks. - secure necessary approvals from the program board. - RePlanning: Undertake continuous replanning and reprioritization, as required, to complete the Program on time. - Metrics Management: Generate and conduct a review of the Program level performance metrics to track the project performance against goals and initiate corrective actions. - Budget Management: Set out a percentage of the budget as contingency plan and carve out the same in the budgetIdentify, incubate and manage any work that is outside the scope of the individual projects (including vendors and external stakeholders), so as to ensure the success of the overall program (eg production readiness, infrastructure changes, user training, Organizational Change Management etc) for high visibility programs. - present the status to BU Head. - Benefits Management: Track benefits realization in program delivery. - Scope Management: In case of changes to the program, conduct an impact analysis on the cost and other organizational parameters and share findings with the client.

column1: India Market Unit - SAP Program Lead - Associate Director
column2: SAP Program Lead for complex transformations Work Location:Delhi, Mumbai | Years of experience:15+ years | Level:Associate Director Accenture is a global professional services company with leading capabilities in digital, cloud & security. Combining unmatched experience & specialized skills across more than 40 industries, we offer Strategy and Consulting, Technology and Operations and Song all powered by the world's largest network of Advanced Technology and Intelligent Operations centers. Our 699,000 people deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity every day, serving clients in more than 120 countries. We embrace the power of change to create value and shared success for our clients, people, shareholders, partners and communities. Visit us at www.accenture.com Role Description: Lead program delivery of extremely complex SAP / S4HANA transformation projects. Responsible for client relationship management, driving change management, review integration across all application requirements, including functional, security, integration, performance, quality and operations requirements. Responsible for timely project delivery with the right quality and within planned budgets. Should be good project scope management possessing good negotiations skills for project change requests. Responsible for managing large teams. Must have Skills:SAP program management experience in either FMCG, Pharma, Auto industry. Good to Have Skills:SAP any module experience. Job Requirements:Must have more than 15 years total experience. Key Responsibilities: SAP S/4 project management. Project tracking in terms of Financials, schedule, scope. Ability to engage with client leadership like CFO, CIO, business heads. Attention to details. Proactive in planning. Strong understanding in MS Project for project tracking. Technical Experience: SAP any modules - S/4 Project management. 2-3 end to end complex implementation experience as project manager in Indian client scenarios. Professional Attributes:Must have performed in client facing roles. Strong Communication skills: Leadership skills. Team handling skills. Analytical skills. Presentation skills. Ability to work under pressure. What's in-store for you? Learn and grow continuously:Build new skills, grow existing skills, develop new areas of expertise within functional, technical or industry areas of the business with Accenture's unmatched 24/7 expert-curated learning boards, webinars, and classroom- style training programs Innovate:Get access to resources that will allow you to leverage the latest technologies and bring innovation to life with the world's most recognizable companies Thrive and advance:Grow your career as far as your ambitions take you Truly human:Bring your whole self to a company that aims to be the most diverse in the world and delivers real-time performance feedback based on your strengths, not stats Qualification Educational Qualification :Should have completed Graduation from reputed College/University

column2: Joining the IBM Technology Expert Labs teams means you'll have a career delivering world-class services for our clients. As the ultimate expert in IBM products, you'll bring together all the necessary technology and services to help customers solve their most challenging problems. Working in IBM Technology Expert Labs means accelerating the time to value confidently and ensuring speed and insight while our clients focus on what they do best-running and growing their business.  Excellent onboarding and industry-leading learning culture will set you up for a positive impact, while advancing your career. Our culture is collaborative and experiential. As part of a team, you will be surrounded by bright minds and keen co-creators-always willing to help and be helped-as you apply passion to work that will positively impact the world around us. Your Role and Responsibilities As a Delivery Leader, you will work with Delivery Consultants worldwide helping them scale the implementation and delivery of services for your technical domain. You'll be accountable for the building, launching and enabling the service delivery team with the expertise needed to accelerate the adoption and deployment of IBM technology to address the customer's challenges. As a change agent, you'll work in collaboration to growth the business thru automation and standardization processes based on proven best practices. In collaboration with a cross function team, you'll lead the strategy to build the practice with emerging techniques and solutions globally. We're passionate about success. If this role is right for you, then your achievements mean your career is flourishing, your teams are succeeding, and our clients are thriving. column2: The SONG Practice | Google Specialist Join our team of SONG consultants who solve customer facing challenges at clients spanning sales, service and marketing to accelerate business change. Practice: SONG  I Areas of Work: Service Google CCAI, Solution and Platform Design  | Level: Manager / Senior Manager  | Location: Delhi, Gurgaon, Mumbai, Bangalore, Chennai, Pune, Hyderabad |  Years of Exp:13 + years Explore an Exciting Career at Accenture  Are you passionate about scaling businesses using in-depth frameworks and techniques to solve customer facing challenges? Do you want to design, build and implement strategies to enhance business performance? Does working in an inclusive and collaborative environment spark your interest? Then, this is the right place for you! Welcome to a host of exciting global opportunities within Accenture Strategy & Consulting's Customer, Sales & Service practice. The practice is aligned to the Capability Network Practice of Accenture and works with clients across their marketing, sales and services functions. As part of the team, you will work on transformation services driven by key offerings like Living Marketing, Connected Commerce and Next-Generation Customer Care. These services help our clients become living businesses by optimizing their marketing, sales and customer service strategy, thereby driving cost reduction, revenue enhancement, customer satisfaction and impacting front end business metrics in a positive manner. You will work closely with our clients as consulting professionals who design, build and implement initiatives that can help enhance business performance. As part of these, you will drive the following: Ability to provide CX solution with Google CCAI suite of contact center products such as Dialogflow CX, Agent Assist, Insights CX and knowledge/experience on Google Gen AI product suite like Vertex AI, Google Gemini, Decibel, Generators, Generative Fallback, Playbooks, LLM based topic modelling, LLM Agent Assist. Co-Lead the Google Contact Center Offering and leverage the previous experience of building the practice from scratch (attracting the best talent in the market and increasing the demand to deliver high impact Google contact center projects) Lead and drive design thinking innovative workshops with the clients using design principles and help shape their Gen AI implementation strategy thinking about the business value proposition and customer experience. Perform CX management capability assessment and identify foundational, evolving and advanced capabilities, co-create the roadmap path with the clients to achieve leading class CX capabilities Formulate CX target operating model and detail out operating model components such as strategic sourcing & mgmt, agent performance management, CX performance, innovation management, CX management, business intelligent and contact center technology support aligned to vision Ability to understand business requirements still putting customer experience at the heart of CX design Ability to think and pre-empt scenarios and questions from cross functional client team (from CX operations, IT, Contact Center operations, digital, analytics, line of business etc) Work with technical Google team/developers to convert user requirements into final product Work with Accenture and client team on CCaaS (Contact Center as a Service) migration, lead existing legacy solution clients on the journey to new solution Lead and deliver agile delivery process, continuous improvement and continuous development Work with other Accenture teams to put forward differentiated CX management solutions for large clients (RFI and RFP process) Participate in pre-sales activities  including response to RFPs, creating proofs of concept, creating effective presentations, demonstrating solutions during client orals, effort, and cost estimation process, etc. Participate in practice-specific initiatives  including creating points of view, creating reusable assets on contact center space, performing analysis on industry research and market trends, and bringing in innovative solutions, etc. Bring your best skills forward to excel at the role: A strong and well-established record of accomplishment in designing and delivering  Google CCAI solutions and platform Experience of working  with business stakeholders across multiple geographic areas, with different priorities and requirements Ability to work  in high-paced and complex projects and understand industry-specific customer service processes, operations, and functional needs Thorough skills  to manage stakeholder expectations and be engaging in resolving issues and risks for the success of the project Thorough understanding  of CCAI Framework and integration with internal and external components. Read about us. Qualification Your experience counts! 13+ years of experience in working with Google CCAI solutions creating virtual agents using Dialogflow, generating meaningful analytics using Insights, designing and implementing customer experience solutions projects (any industry). Passion for building leading class Google contact center solutions for clients Having thorough understanding of end to end Google contact center transformation Thorough understanding of CX & contact center architecture and project experience with Google CCAI solution is a must Experience on working with other Conversational AI (like Amazon Lex, IBM Watson, Microsoft PVA, Nuance, Khoros, etc.) and CCaaS platforms (Genesys, Amazon Connect, Avaya, Cisco, Sprinklr, etc.) is good to have Experience of building Gen AI based use-cases and solutions that work across industries and markets Story boarding, creating differentiated solution as per client needs and compelling story telling is a must Ability to work with ambiguity and exploratory mindset is a must Strong Analytical skills, excellent written and oral communication skills Experience working in a large, complex global team environment Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present at the Board and C-level Strong project management, facilitation, and organization skills High on impact and influence Performance/Status reporting to steering committee Problem Solving and Conflict Management Ability to work effectively in a remote, inclusive, virtual, global environment What's in it for you? An opportunity to work on

column2: At TTEC Digital, we coach clients to ensure their employees feel valued, and fully supported, because an amazing customer experience is an employee first process. Our vision is the same, a place where employees know they can thrive. We are seeking a highly motivated Delivery Excellence Lead to join our team in India. The ideal candidate will have experience in client-facing delivery, in Project Management and Change Management roles and be able to work independently with strong attention to detail. The successful candidate will be responsible for developing and delivering successful outcomes that drive our teams to be more market ready, delivery capable, and deliver a differentiated client experience to those with whom we partner.  What   You   Will   Be   Doing A. Primary Role: Delivery Excellence Lead (Sr. Manager or Director) Work with Practice Sales leaders, Delivery leaders, Project Managers towards: Building a one-TTEC Digital sales and delivery motion Managing our delivery experience framework, CXEdge (method) to continuously evolve Building execution frameworks to support key governance activities in the firm Leading cross-functional teams to align expectations and drive change under our firm-wide LaunchX initiative Coach delivery teams in all aspects of the SDLC on best practices, approaches Drive development, advocacy, and adoption of business improvement initiatives within our India Innovation Studio across all practices. Build and deploy organizational structures to support business operations models, such as managed services, monitoring services, pre-sales, estimation, and account management as appropriate. B. Manage projects as a project manager within the context of business improvement initiatives. Strong critical thinking and problem-solving skills Ability to work in a fast-paced environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously. column2: The roles within MTS are diverse and continually evolving to meet the demands of a rapidly changing digital landscape. If this idea of working with a dynamic and creative team playing the pivotal role in shaping the modern media landscape excites you, apply for this opportunity with us!           What will you do         Sound Expertise:    Perform mixing, sound designing, multi-format mixing, and optionally music composition. Engage in dubbing activities and oversee their execution.        Managerial Responsibilities:    Handle audio bookings efficiently. Create detailed studio reports and data sheets. Develop impactful PowerPoint presentations.        Collaboration:    Engage collaboratively across all phases of audio production. Prioritize tasks effectively and communicate transparently across sound-related projects.        Support and Ideation:    Assist the creative team in conceptualizing and executing audio design concepts. Provide support in ideation and execution for creative audio projects.        Reporting and Documentation:    Prepare and submit Management Information System (MIS) reports as required by department heads.                Who should apply for this role         Experience:    The candidate should possess a minimum of 5 years of experience in Broadcast Media / OTT or related areas. Additionally, a profound proficiency in Digital Audio Workstation (DAW) software like Pro Tools is essential. A comprehensive understanding of its functionalities enables the candidate to navigate and utilize the software effectively.        Technical Proficiency:    The candidate should showcase hands-on experience in mixing multi-track audio formats such as 5.1 or Atmos. Proficiency in handling diverse audio equipment, including mixing consoles, microphones, preamps, compressors, and multi-channel speaker setups, is vital. This technical expertise ensures seamless execution across various audio-related tasks and projects. Proficiency in essential software applications such as Microsoft Excel, Word, and PowerPoint is crucial for streamlined project management and documentation.        Software Knowledge:    Familiarity with plugins like Waves and Izotope, along with various mastering and mixing plugins, is highly beneficial. A deep understanding of these tools contributes to refining and enhancing the quality of audio outputs.        Adaptability and Communication:    The candidate should exhibit high adaptability and flexibility to thrive in challenging work environments, including weekends and holidays. Effective inter-departmental collaboration and communication skills are imperative for seamless coordination and execution of audio projects across teams.        Passionate and Skilled:    A genuine passion for promos, film trailers, and sound designing is essential. The candidate should possess a high level of skill in crafting creative audio products, reflecting a deep-seated enthusiasm for the craft.        Expertise:    Demonstrable expertise in audio post-production hardware and software is a fundamental requirement. Proficiency in Pro Tools, a cornerstone in audio engineering, is indispensable for successful execution within this role.

column2: Position Overview: As the Chief Technology Officer (CTO) for our university in Bengaluru, you will hold a pivotal role in shaping our technological vision, strategy, and direction. Leading a team of talented professionals, you will drive innovation, implement cutting-edge solutions, and manage our technology infrastructure to support and enhance our mission, objectives, and operations. This is an exciting opportunity to spearhead digital transformation and revolutionize the educational experience through technology. Key Responsibilities: Technology Strategy Development : Develop and execute a comprehensive technology strategy aligned with the university's mission and goals, ensuring that technology initiatives bolster teaching, learning, research, and administrative functions. Leadership and Team Management : Provide visionary leadership to the technology team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement. Build and mentor a high-performing team of IT professionals, empowering them to excel in their respective areas. Technology Infrastructure Management : Oversee the design, implementation, and management of robust and scalable technology infrastructure, including networks, servers, databases, and cloud services, to ensure optimal performance, reliability, and security. Information Security and Data Privacy : Develop and enforce information security policies, procedures, and best practices to safeguard the university's digital assets and protect against cybersecurity threats. Ensure compliance with relevant data privacy regulations and standards. Enterprise Applications and Systems Integration : Drive the selection, deployment, and integration of enterprise applications and systems that streamline operations, enhance efficiency, and improve user experience across academic and administrative departments. Innovation and Emerging Technologies : Stay abreast of emerging technologies, trends, and best practices in the education and technology sectors. Evaluate potential opportunities for innovation and digital transformation, leading pilot projects and initiatives to test and implement new solutions. Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement : Collaborate with academic and administrative stakeholders to understand their technology needs and priorities. Foster partnerships with external vendors, industry partners, and research institutions to leverage expertise and resources for mutual benefit. Budgeting and Resource Management : Develop and manage the technology budget, ensuring efficient allocation of resources and cost-effective procurement of hardware, software, and services. Monitor and report on key performance indicators and financial metrics to senior leadership. Governance and Compliance : Establish and maintain IT governance frameworks, policies, and procedures to ensure transparency, accountability, and compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity : Develop and maintain comprehensive disaster recovery and business continuity plans to mitigate risks and minimize disruptions to critical systems and operations in the event of unforeseen incidents or disasters. Qualifications: Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Advanced degree and relevant certifications preferred. Proven experience of 10+ years in a senior leadership role overseeing technology strategy, operations, and innovation, preferably in higher education or a large, complex organization. Demonstrated expertise in enterprise architecture, infrastructure design, cloud computing, cybersecurity, and emerging technologies. Strong leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills, with the ability to inspire and influence cross-functional teams and stakeholders at all levels. Strategic thinking, problem-solving, and decision-making abilities, with a track record of driving successful technology initiatives and delivering measurable results. Experience in budgeting, financial management, and vendor relationship management. Knowledge of relevant regulatory requirements and compliance standards. Commitment to diversity, equity, and inclusion, with a passion for leveraging technology to advance educational opportunities and outcomes for all students and stakeholders. Application Process : Only shortlisted candidates will be contacted for interviews.

column2: We are looking for enthusiastic colleague ready to work in a fast-paced organisation to develop our online engagement platforms to deepen our relationships with key stakeholders     The Digital Engagement Specialist will lead the work of exciting new projects in 2023 and 2024, including the build of a communities engagement platform, new website launch and support how we use Salesforce to improve our overall efficiency     The Digital Engagement Specialist will have exceptional platform and website development skills, be an apt project manger and able to work well with the team to excite them and our core stakeholders to use and visit our digital platforms                           Key Responsibilities             Communities engagement hub       Procure and work in strategic collaboration with a platform developer to build a safe, engaging platform which is interoperable with our current systems and which works for our Members and other stakeholders.      Take a user journey approach to develop the platform, consulting where relevant with partners and members to ensure the platform suits their needs.      Train and guide the Consumers International team to use the platform, and ensure it becomes their go-to means to engage the stakeholders we work with.      Onboard Members and other stakeholders to use the platform, providing guidance tools and responding to their queries.      Report to the Leadership Team at Consumers International on engagement statistics, team use and how to mitigate challenges.      Upload content and support the team to upload including developing surveys, calls-to-action & other platform aspects.        Insights Hub       Lead on designing and developing an online system which gathers quality consumer insights from around the world, to help inform better policy and business practice and enable our Members and partners understand latest consumer issues.      Develop a framework for the system which ensures information is accurate and reliable, and which uses automation where possible for efficiency.      Work with the Consumers International team to ensure the system pools from multiple online sources (e.g., reports, global surveys) across consumer policy insights, consumer behaviour studies, new academic research, as well as to incorporate data from our Members.        Website relaunch       Lead our website relaunch in early 2024, carrying out procurement, onboarding of a developer.      Oversee all aspects of project management, working closely with the communications team to      consult on the design and content stages.      Ensure the project remains on-track and key individuals across the organisation contribute where      need be, with the support of the Leadership Team.      Take a consultative approach to the website build, running user cases for website visitors.        Other online engagement       Support how we use Salesforce features to improve engagement with our Members and others through features to design events, subgroups of stakeholders and more.      Undertake other duties as required by the role to support digital engagement for our team and audiences.            Personal Specification          ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS CRITERIA EXPERIENCE & UNDERSTANDING       Over 3 years experience in developing platforms and/or websites to engage communities in closed door and public settings.      Understanding of what it takes to make a community engagement platform unique and a success, and to ensure interoperability with other systems.      Experience in using open-source content management systems.      Experience in website relaunches, seeing the project through from start to completion.        SKILLS AND ABILITIES       A team player.      Able to excite individuals to use new tools and systems they are unfamiliar with.      Strong organisation skills and the ability to manage multiple deadlines.      Fluent in spoken and written English.      Strong IT skills with excellent use of MS Office and a good grasp of virtual meeting software (e.g. Zoom or Teams).      Applies innovation to meet challenges, assess risk and solutions and obtain best results.        OTHER ESSENTIAL REQUIREMENTS       Commitment to the aims and objectives of Consumers International.      Able to thrive in a multicultural, collaborative and agile environment.      Able to quickly adapt and work in a fast-paced work environment.      Outstanding collaborator, with the ability to build strong relationships internally and externally      Self-motivated, pro-active and able to work efficiently without close supervision.      Excellent project management experience (use of Microsoft Projects would be an asset).        DESIRABLE REQUIREMENTS       Development of a communities engagement hub for a large membership organisation.          Second language would be an asset (French, Spanish or Arabic).          Good understanding of how consumer insights can build better policy and business practice.

Level 8"The contractor sourcing Associate Manager is responsible for the sourcing and recruitment of contract resources for Accenture.Key responsibilites:1. Provide leading practices regarding contractor recruitment options to align with defined objectives and budget.2. Operates with a large degree of autonomy and independence. Provides recommendations on policy/process improvements and provides input to the development of new procedures for area of responsibility. Typically supervises and plans and prioritizes complex activities for team. 4. Uses judgment to make a variety of decisions, most complex in nature. Decisions occasionally impact other teams5. Builds a quality relationship with the internal customers and external recruitment agencies6. Manages customer/ client relationships within own area of responsibility. Resolves most customer/client requestsExcellent communication skillsExcellent negotiation skillsJob Interviewing SkillsManagerial and leadership skillsAnalytical skillsSocial Media KnowledgeTraining SkillsFirm understanding of compensation practices Knowledge of HR and Talent Management /Recruitment domainMS OfficeEmail Writing SkillsProblem solving skills (Analytical skills / Collabrative thinking/ Adaptable to change)Excellent organizational skills and attention to detail.A proven track record of managing recruiters for multiple clients.Strong knowledge of recruitment practices, metrics, and guidelines.Excellent leadership and project management skills.10-12 years of Recruitment / temp staffing experienceGraduate DegreeYou will be responsible for Vendor Management where in you need to manage third parties and vendors that supply goods and or services to entities in the application management space. You will be responsible for handling multiple activities included in researching and sourcing vendors, obtaining quotes with pricing, capabilities, turnaround times, and quality of work, negotiating contracts, managing relationships, assigning jobs, evaluating performance, and ensuring payments are made. Recruitment & talent development  Roles and Responsibilities: In this role you are required to do analysis and solving of moderately complex problems Typically creates new solutions, leveraging and, where needed, adapting existing methods and procedures The person requires understanding of the strategic direction set by senior management as it relates to team goals Primary upward interaction is with direct supervisor or team leads Generally interacts with peers and/or management levels at a client and/or within Accenture The person should require minimal guidance when determining methods and procedures on new assignments Decisions often impact the team in which they reside and occasionally impact other teams Individual would manage medium-small sized teams and/or work efforts (if in an individual contributor role) at a client or within Accenture Please note that this role may require you to work in rotational shifts Qualification Master of Business Administration

column2: Your Role and Responsibilities The Service Delivery Manager (SDM) for Cybersecurity is responsible for ensuring the successful delivery of cybersecurity services to clients. This role involves managing the cybersecurity operations, coordinating with different departments, and ensuring that all security services meet the agreed service levels and client expectations. The SDM will act as the primary point of contact for clients regarding cybersecurity services and will oversee the implementation and maintenance of security measures. Key Responsibilities: Service Management: Ensure the delivery of cybersecurity services to clients within agreed service levels. Develop and maintain service level agreements (SLAs) and operational level agreements (OLAs) for cybersecurity services. Monitor and report on service delivery metrics and key performance indicators (KPIs). Conduct regular service reviews with clients and internal stakeholders. Client Relationship Management: Act as the main point of contact for clients regarding cybersecurity services. Build and maintain strong relationships with clients, understanding their needs and ensuring satisfaction. Address and resolve any issues or concerns raised by clients promptly. Operational Oversight: Oversee the day-to-day operations of the cybersecurity team. Ensure that cybersecurity incidents and breaches are managed effectively and in a timely manner. Coordinate with other departments to ensure seamless delivery of services. Develop and implement processes and procedures to improve operational efficiency and service delivery. Project Management: Manage cybersecurity projects from initiation to completion. Ensure that projects are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget. Coordinate with clients and internal teams to define project requirements and deliverables. Risk Management: Identify and assess cybersecurity risks to clients and the organization. Develop and implement strategies to mitigate identified risks. Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards. Continuous Improvement: Continuously seek opportunities to improve service delivery processes and client satisfaction. Stay updated with the latest developments in cybersecurity and incorporate best practices into service delivery. Required Technical and Professional Expertise Bachelor's degree in Information Security, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Relevant certifications such as CISSP, CISM, ITIL, or PMP are highly desirable. Minimum of 5 years of experience in a cybersecurity role, with at least 2 years in a service delivery or management position. Proven experience in managing client relationships and delivering cybersecurity services. Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise Strong understanding of cybersecurity principles, technologies, and best practices. Excellent project management and organizational skills. Strong leadership and team management abilities. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to handle multiple priorities and work under pressure. Analytical and problem-solving skills.
column11: project management, program delivery, team management, pmp, service delivery, it program management, program management, delivery leadership, product management, delivery management, stakeholder management, agile, service delivery management
